meanings.sent1: After playing outside, the kids managed to scunge up their clothes.
meanings.sent2: Please don't scunge the kitchen counter with your muddy shoes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy decided to scunge the freshly cleaned floor with its muddy paws.
meanings.sent4: The rain continued to scunge the once pristine streets, turning them into a muddy mess.
meanings.sent5: The old abandoned house looked as if it had been scunged by years of neglect.

meanings.definition: A dirty or untidy person or place.
meanings.sent1: The scunge at the park made it less appealing for a picnic.
meanings.sent2: The scunge in the corner of the room needed to be cleaned up.
meanings.sent3: The scunge in the alley seemed to have a life of its own, growing bigger each day.
meanings.sent4: The scunge on the old car made it look like it had been forgotten for years.
meanings.sent5: The scunge in the neglected garden seemed to thrive in the shadows.
